Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can include different kinds of plants and animals in their drawing to show the variety of life in a habitat.
The student can observe and draw specific examples of land habitats (like a garden or forest) and water habitats (like a pond or stream).
The student can draw and label different types of living things, such as trees, bushes, fish, or insects, in each habitat.
The student can use their drawing to compare how the types of plants and animals differ between two habitats.
The student can recognize and illustrate patterns of diversity amongst plants and animals in different habitats, showing how life is distributed on land and in water.
